name: Project Deflect
description: As part of the Carnegie Mellon Summer Academy for Math and Science, we're currently working on a game with the Entertainment Technology center called Project Deflect. This will be an arcade-like game where a series of four hexagons with different-colored sides that must rotate and match the side of the hexagon with the color of the incoming beams from bacteria and viruses to deflect the beams. It will support the use of arcade joysticks and compatibility with up to four players. We anticipate to release this game by August 9th, 2018. You can check our developer log to see our development progress on the game so far.
